Text: When the LORD restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dreamed.
Context: This verse reflects the elation of the Israelites upon returning from exile;  it compares their joy to a surreal, dream-like experience.

Text: Our mouths were filled with laughter, our tongues with shouts of joy. Then it was said among the nations, "The LORD has done great things for them."
Context: The Israelites express their joy openly, and their happiness becomes a testimony among other nations of Godâ€™s blessings.

Text: The LORD has done great things for us; we are filled with joy.
Context: This verse reaffirms the sentiments of the previous verse, emphasizing the joyous acknowledgment of God's blessings.

Text: Restore our fortunes, LORD, like streams in the Negev.
Context: This verse is a petition to God to continue to restore their fortunes, comparing the restoration to the streams that refresh the arid region of the Negev.

Text: Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy.
Context: A promise of hope that those who endure hardship and sorrow will ultimately experience joy.

Text: He who goes out weeping, carrying seed to sow, will return with songs of joy, carrying sheaves with him.
Context: This verse continues the theme of hope from the previous verse, declaring that hard work and endurance through difficult times will lead to a joyful harvest.
